conclusion: Air resistance is modeled as constant for simplicity.
The acceleration during descent is g(1 - λ).
The velocity just before impact is √(2g(1 - λ)H).
The ratio of post-collision velocity to pre-collision velocity is the coefficient of restitution.
The acceleration during ascent is -g(1 + λ).
The final velocity at height h should be zero.
The equation for v_rebound is derived correctly.
